Extender class to provide access to the Application Control Reserved Sigs feature of the Digital Graphics Engines.
This class will trigger event.

member.summary: Method to dial an asterisk.

member.summary: Method to dial a pound sign "#".

member.summary: Method to issue a backspace on the current dialed number.

member.summary: Method to clear the entire dial string.

member.summary: Method to dial the current number string in the buffer.

member.summary: Method to answer an incoming call.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.MercuryBluetoothReservedSigs.Hangup
member.summary: Method to terminate the current call or reject any incoming call.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.MercuryBluetoothReservedSigs.StartPairing
member.summary: Method to start pairing. In this mode, the device will be in a discoverable mode.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.MercuryBluetoothReservedSigs.StopPairing
member.summary: Method to stop pairing.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.MercuryBluetoothReservedSigs.UnpairAllDevices
member.summary: Method to unpair all the devices which are currently paired.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.MercuryBluetoothReservedSigs.Ignore
member.summary: Method to ignore the current call. In this mode, an incoming call is unanswered and the local ring will be turned off

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.MercuryBluetoothReservedSigs.Transfer
member.summary: Method to transfer the current call's audio back to the paired device.

member.summary: Method to initialize the sigs of the ApplicationControl extender

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.MercuryBluetoothReservedSigs.Mute
member.summary: Property to mute/unmute the current calls

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.MercuryBluetoothReservedSigs.DeviceName
member.summary: Property to set the name of the bluetooth device. The maximum length for the device name is restricted to 8 characters.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.MercuryBluetoothReservedSigs.DialString
member.summary: Property to set the dial string for the DTMF tones

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.MercuryBluetoothReservedSigs.CallNoneFeedback
member.summary: Property to indicate that a call is not in progress.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.MercuryBluetoothReservedSigs.OutgoingCallFeedback
member.summary: Property to indicate that we have an outgoing call.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.MercuryBluetoothReservedSigs.IncomingCallFeedback
member.summary: Property to indicate that we have an incoming call

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.MercuryBluetoothReservedSigs.CallActiveFeedback
member.summary: Property to indicate that the call is active

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.MercuryBluetoothReservedSigs.PairFeedback
member.summary: Property to indicate that the device is or is not currently paired with another device.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.MercuryBluetoothReservedSigs.RemoteName
member.summary: Property to indicate the name of the remote party call.Will be cleared at the termination of the call.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.MercuryBluetoothReservedSigs.RemoteNumber
member.summary: Property to indicate the remote caller number.Will be cleared at the termination of the call.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.MercuryBluetoothReservedSigs.DialBuffer
member.summary: Property to report the dial buffer. Will be cleared at the termination of a call or by using the method.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.MercuryBluetoothReservedSigs.PairedDeviceName
member.summary: Property to report paired device name.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.MercuryBluetoothReservedSigs.DeviceNameFeedback
member.summary: Property to return the name of the bluetooth device.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.MercuryBluetoothReservedSigs.DeviceStateFeedback
member.summary:
Property to indicate the device state.
The event will trigger with and .
The valid values are
0 - Driver not available
1 - No device paired
2 - Device is paired. Not active, No music
3 - Device is paired and music playing
4 - Indicates an incoming call
5 - Indicates that we are making an outgoing call
6 - Indicates that the far end is ringing
7 - Indicates that we are on a call

member.summary:
Extender class to provide access to the Audio Reserved Sigs feature of the Digital Graphics Engines.
This class will trigger event.

member.summary: Method to turn on the speakers.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.MercuryAudioReservedSigs.AllAudioOff
member.summary: Method to turn off the speakers.

member.summary: Method to turn key click on.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.MercuryAudioReservedSigs.KeyClickOff
member.summary: Method to turn key click off.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.MercuryAudioReservedSigs.MicOn
member.summary: Turns on mic audio.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.MercuryAudioReservedSigs.MicOff
member.summary: Turns off mic audio.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.MercuryAudioReservedSigs.InitializeJoins
member.summary: Method to initialize the Sigs of the Audio extender

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.MercuryAudioReservedSigs.AllAudioOnFeedback
member.summary:
Property to indicate the speaker audio is enabled.
The event will trigger with and .

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.MercuryAudioReservedSigs.AllAudioOffFeedback
member.summary:
Property to indicate the speaker audio is disabled.
The event will trigger with and .

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.MercuryAudioReservedSigs.AllAudioVolumeUp
member.summary: Property to raise the speaker volume by 1% if input is true. This property has no effect once the volume reaches 100%. If the property remains true the volume will auto-increment until the property is set to false or until the maximum volume is reached.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.MercuryAudioReservedSigs.AllAudioVolumeDown
member.summary: Property to lower the speaker volume by 1%. This property has no effect once the volume reaches 0%. If the property remains true the volume will auto-decrement until the property is set to false or until the volume reaches 0%.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.MercuryAudioReservedSigs.KeyClickOnFeedback
member.summary: Property to indicate key click is on.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.MercuryAudioReservedSigs.KeyClickOffFeedback
member.summary: Property to indicate key click is off.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.MercuryAudioReservedSigs.KeyClickVolumeUp
member.summary: Property to raise the key click volume by 1% if input is true. This property has no effect once the volume reaches 100%. If the property remains true the volume will auto-increment until the property is set to false or until the maximum volume is reached.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.MercuryAudioReservedSigs.KeyClickVolumeDown
member.summary: Property to lower the key click volume by 1%. This property has no effect once the volume reaches 0%. If the property remains true the volume will auto-decrement until the property is set to false or until the volume reaches 0%.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.MercuryAudioReservedSigs.AllAudioVolume
member.summary: Property to set the speaker volume level.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.MercuryAudioReservedSigs.AllAudioVolumeFeedback
member.summary:
Property to report the speaker volume level.
The event will trigger with and .

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.MercuryAudioReservedSigs.KeyClickVolume
member.summary: Property to set the key click volume level.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.MercuryAudioReservedSigs.KeyClickVolumeFeedback
member.summary:
Property to report the key click volume level.
The event will trigger with and .

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.MercuryAudioReservedSigs.MicOnFeedback
member.summary: Indicates that mic audio is on. The feedback remains true for as long as mic audio is on.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.MercuryAudioReservedSigs.MicOffFeedback
member.summary: Indicates that mic audio is off. The feedback remains true for as long as mic audio is off.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.MercuryAudioReservedSigs.MicVolume
member.summary:
Sets the mic volume level.
Valid values range from 0% (mute mic input) to 100% (maximum mic volume). Use to convert the percentage to a ushort value or to convert the ushort value to percentage.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.MercuryAudioReservedSigs.MicVolumeFeedback
member.summary:
Reports the mic volume level.
The reported level is the value that is set via the mic volume analog input, or adjusted via the mic volume up/down digital inputs.

member.summary:

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.MercurySystemReservedSigs.StandbyTimeoutUp
member.summary: Property to increment the standby timeout by one minute.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.MercurySystemReservedSigs.StandbyTimeoutDown
member.summary: Property to decrement the standby timeout by one minute.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.MercurySystemReservedSigs.StandbyTimeout
member.summary: Property to set the standby timeout in minutes. The standby timeout is the period from the last use of the touchscreen before going into standby mode (screen display is off but power is on).

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.MercurySystemReservedSigs.StandbyTimeoutFeedback
member.summary:
Property to report the standby timeout period.
The event will trigger with and .

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.MercurySystemReservedSigs.HardkeyBankAColor
member.summary: Property to set the LED color of the Bank A. Valid values are as follows: 0d = Off 1d = Green 2d = Red

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.MercurySystemReservedSigs.HardkeyBankBColor
member.summary: Set the color for the bank B LED's. 0 = Off, 1 = Green, and 2 = Red.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.MercurySystemReservedSigs.HardkeyBankBColorFeedback
member.summary:
Get the color of the bank B buttons as reported by the device. 0 = Off, 1 = Green, and 2 = Red.
The event will trigger with and .

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.MercurySystemReservedSigs.HardkeyBankAColorFeedback
member.summary: Property to track the value of the Bank A LED color.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.MercurySystemReservedSigs.GreenBrightness
member.summary: Property to set the green color backlight brightness. Valid values range from 0% (minimum brightness) to 100% (maximum brightness).

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.MercurySystemReservedSigs.GreenBrightnessFeedback
member.summary: Property to report the green color backlight brightness.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.MercurySystemReservedSigs.RedBrightness
member.summary: Property to set the red color backlight brightness. Valid values range from 0% (minimum brightness) to 100% (maximum brightness).

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.MercurySystemReservedSigs.RedBrightnessFeedback
member.summary: Property to report the red color backlight brightness.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.MercurySystemReservedSigs.GreenBrightnessUp
member.summary: Property to raise the green backlight brightness by 1%. If the property value remains true for 0.5 seconds the brightness will auto-increment until the property value becomes false or until it reaches the maximum value of 100%.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.MercurySystemReservedSigs.GreenBrightnessDown
member.summary: Property to lower the green backlight brightness by 1%. If the property value remains true for 0.5 seconds the brightness will auto-adjust until the the property value becomes false or until it reaches the minimum value of 0%.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.MercurySystemReservedSigs.RedBrightnessUp
member.summary: Property to raise the red backlight brightness by 1%. If the property value remains true for 0.5 seconds the brightness will auto-increment until the property value becomes false or until it reaches the maximum value of 100%.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.MercurySystemReservedSigs.RedBrightnessDown
member.summary: Property to lower the red backlight brightness by 1%. If the property value remains true for 0.5 seconds the brightness will auto-adjust until the the property value becomes false or until it reaches the minimum value of 0%.

member.summary:
Property to indicate that the clock display is in 24-hour format.

member.summary: Property to disable time display in 24-hour format.

member.summary: Property to enable the feature to display the temperature with tenths of a degree.

member.summary:
Property to indicate the temperature is displayed with tenths of a degree.

member.summary: Property to enable the feature to display the temperature in whole numbers only without tenths of a degree.

member.summary:
Property to indicate the temperature is displayed in whole numbers only.
The event will trigger with and .

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.MercuryScreenSaverReservedSigs.TemperatureA
member.summary: Property to set an optional temperature value A along with the time. Any signed decimal value.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.MercuryScreenSaverReservedSigs.TemperatureB
member.summary: Property to set an optional temperature value B along with the time. Any signed decimal value.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.MercuryScreenSaverReservedSigs.ScreensaverDisplayText
member.summary: Property to set an optional second text string to be displayed with the time; this text string is displayed directly below the top text string as defined by the sig.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.MercuryScreenSaverReservedSigs.TemperatureScale
member.summary: Property to set the temp scale. “C”, “F”, or “K” are valid values.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.MercuryScreenSaverReservedSigs.ScreenSaverTopDisplayText
member.summary: Property to set an optional text string to be displayed with the time; this text string is displayed directly above the bottom text string as defined by the sig.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.MercuryTouchDetectionReservedSigs.TouchActivityFeedback
member.summary:
Property to report that touch activity is detected on the touch screen or a hard button. This property value remains 'true' for the period defined in .
The event will trigger with and .

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.MercuryTouchDetectionReservedSigs.Time
member.summary: Property to specify the amount of time, in seconds, that is to remain true after a touch event has been detected. Valid values range from 0 to 300, where 1 = 1 second.
member.remarks: This value will not be affected by a reboot.
